bib_pregnancy_matrecs_bib_mum.html
Maternity records mother info Table details Variable details

Maternity records mother info Abstraction of routine information from maternal paper records for the Born in Bradford cohort. The abstraction was funded by a NIHR HTA project (11-99-02). Four trained research assistants abstracted data from maternal paper records. The abstraction was conducted in 2013. Only women with completed baseline questionnaires, oral glucose tolerance test results and birth outcomes were eligible. Data were entered straight into a web database. Accuracy of abstractions were checked on 5% of records for all abstracted data, all error rates were less than 1%. This source contains information about the mother derived from this exercise. Table details BiB_Pregnancy.matrecs_bib_mum Cohort membership BiB Entity Participant Dimensions Updated 2024-05-14 Variable details

bib_pregnancy_fetal_renal.html
Fetal renal ultrasound Table details Variable details

Fetal renal ultrasound Ultrasound scans around 34 weeks gestation to measure fetal kidney dimensions (transverse and anteroposterior diameters, length and circumference) and derived volume. This is a nested cohort within the full BiB cohort. Women were recruited at a routine glucose tolerance test at 26-28 weeks gestation and invited to return for a further fetal ultrasound at 34 weeks gestation. Table details BiB_Pregnancy.fetal_renal Cohort membership BiB Entity Participant Dimensions Updated 2024-05-14 Variable details

Yorkshire and Humber Congenital Anomalies Register Contains data entered into the Yorkshire and Humber Congenital Anomalies Register database. This source holds long data at child level, one ICD10 code per row. These are the final codes, which are not always the same as those initially notified. Note that not all of these were confirmed post-natally, see variable yhcarlConfirmedPostnatally. Table details BiB_Congenital_Anomalies.conganom_yhcar Cohort membership BiB Entity Participant Dimensions Updated 2024-05-14 Variable details

Congenital Anomalies GP record linkage to 5yo Congenital anomalies up to 5 years of age, identified in GP records by Bishop et al (doi: 10.1136/bmjpo-2017-000171) following EUROCAT guidelines (https://bit.ly/2SS1gVc). bib_geographic_bib_geog_person.html
BiB person level geographic information Table details Variable details

BiB person level geographic information Contains address information for each BiB participant at regular 6 month intervals from the first event of study participation (e.g.Â birth or registration). Contains person level information, such as age, property lived in, number of house moves and data quality indicators. Usage instructions: This is a long dataset, with many rows per participant, and can be used to identify which property and LSOA the participant lived in at a certain age or time point. This can be linked to property level data (including environmental exposures) using âproperty_idâ and LSOA level data using âLSOA11CDâ to obtain property/LSOA level data for specific time periods in a particpants life. Data construction: The source data for this table is address strings from monthly searches of the NHS Tracing service (e.g.Â health care records), which contain limited geographic information and are temporally irregular. To improve the quality of the geographic data, the address strings are passed through the OS Places API, which attempts to match each address string to a geo-located address, providing additional geographic information. Important information on temporal data: This dataset contains data from two separate timelines, which are important to clarify. Temporal variables fixed to the participants age such as age_m are calculated at 6 monthly periods based on date of birth. Separately, address data from NHS tracing services, such as date_address_data_received is received as and when, and may not align with the 6 monthly time periods used to structure the dataset. Where this occurs, address data for some 6 monthly time points has been interpolated from the nearest available data from NHS tracing. The variable is_data_interpolated flags if data has been interpolated, whilst months_to_closest_data_received can be used to assess the temporal difference between the participants age, and the recency of the address data. Table details BiB_Geographic.bib_geog_person Cohort membership BiB Entity Participant Dimensions Updated 2024-05-15 Variable details

BiB property level air quality information Building level air quality data. Contains measures of mean and maximum exposures to PM10, PM2.5 and NOx, using Bradford Council (CBMDC) and Department for Environment (DEFRA) data. Variables cover a range from exposure radii (from 100m to 2000m) measured using both circular buffers and street networks centred on the home address. Usage instructions: To link to BiB participants, use the property_id variable to link to bib_geog_person. Further information: Created by Kimon Krenz, on behalf of BiB. Please reference Krenz et al.Â (2023) when using this data, where more detailed methodological information can be found regarding the construction of these variables. bib_geographic_bib_geog_ndvi_longitudinal.html
BiB property level longitudinal NDVI data Table details Variable details

BiB property level longitudinal NDVI data Longitudinal NDVI data for all years from 2016 to 2022. Calculated the mean for standard circular buffer around home addresses for radii of 100, 300, 500, 1000, 1500, and 2000m using USGS Landsat 8 data. For 2020 there is also NDVI calculated using street network based catchment areas of 100, 300, 500 and 1000m. ** Notes on missing data** There is no cloud-free satellite imagery for the years 2021 and 2017 that covers the entire area of Bradford, meaning there are missing values for both years for properties in south east Bradford. Missing data could be inferred by calculating the average value of the years before and after the years with no data. Usage instructions: To link to BiB participants, use the property_id variable to link to bib_geog_person. Further information: Created by Kimon Krenz, on behalf of BiB. Please reference Krenz et al.Â (2023) when using this data, where more detailed methodological information can be found regarding the construction of these variables. BiB property level public transport and traffic data Summarises the availability of public transport and volume of vehicle traffic at property address. Amount of public transport access points (e.g.Â bus stops, train stations) are measured using distance decay and street network distance at a range of radii (300m to 2000m). Vehicle traffic volume is measured at morning, afternoon and evening within a street network distance of 100m and 300m, with additional measures of congestion at the same time periods. BiB property level street centrality, walkability and land use data Table details Variable details

BiB property level street centrality, walkability and land use data Summarises the walkability and urban composition in the area surrounding the property address. Average walkability is measured through a circular buffer at a range of radii. Street centrality measures betweenness and closeness centrality of the residential street and the street network at a range of radii. Land use is measured through Shannonâs Diversity Index through a circular buffer at a range of radii. Usage instructions: To link to BiB participants, use the id column to link to the property_id variable in bib_geog_person. Further information: Created by Kimon Krenz, on behalf of Born in Bradford. Please reference Krenz et al.Â (2023) when using this data, where more detailed methodological information can be found regarding the construction of these variables. bib_medall_medall_greenspace.html
MeDALL Green Space Questionnaire Table details Variable details

MeDALL Green Space Questionnaire A questionnaire was developed by Dr Rosie McEachan with colleagues at Staffordshire University (Dr Chris Gidlow) and CREAL (Prof Mark Nieuwenhuijsen, Dr Payam Dadvand) to explore perceptions of quality of local green space, and estimates of time children spend playing in green space in summer and winter months. This questionnaire was approved by Leeds Bradford REC on 31st May 2013 as a substantial amendment (no.3) to the MeDALL (Mechanisms of the Development of ALLergy) study REF: 12/YH/0252, original approval date 12th June 2012. It was administered to English speaking mothers who were attending a MEDALL study appointment when their infants were aged 4-5. Data is available on n=821 mothers. Researchers wishing to use this questionnaire should contact Dr Rosie McEachan (rosie.mceachan@bthft.nhs.uk) in the first instance. Table details BiB_MeDALL.medall_greenspace Cohort membership BiB Entity Participant Dimensions Updated 2024-05-14 Variable details

MeDALL Neighbourhood Green Space Tool An audit of 45 green spaces in Bradford was conducted in June-July 2015 to examine the present quality of spaces. Spaces were selected on the basis they were visited most frequently by a MEDALL sub-sample. Two assessors completed the audit using an adaptation of Gidlowâs (2012) Neighbourhood Green Space Tool. This tool measures the quality of âneighbourhoodâ urban green space, including access, recreational facilities, amenities, natural features, incivilities and usage. bib_startingschool_stschool_bpvs.html
Starting School BPVS Table details Variable details

Starting School BPVS Starting School was a research project that engaged Bradford primary schools and which ran for two consecutive academic years (2012-13 and 2013-14). The project aimed to assess all children in their first (reception) year of schooling who were in schools where there were at least 10 Born in Bradford children enrolled. Ninety-four out of the 142 primary schools in Bradford were contacted in the recruitment phase. The British Picture Vocabulary Scale (BPVS) is a one-to-one test that assesses a childâs receptive vocabulary. For each question, the assessor says a word and the child responds by selecting a picture from four options that best illustrates the wordâs meaning. As no reading is required, BPVS can be used to assess language development in non-readers and especially pupils with expressive language impairments. Because no spoken response is required, the assessment may be administered to pupils with autism and other related communication difficulties or those with English as an Additional Language (EAL). To help with administration to pupils who may be colour blind the illustrations have black outlines and the colours are vivid. Table details BiB_StartingSchool.stschool_bpvs Cohort membership BiB Entity Participant Dimensions Updated 2024-05-14 Variable details

bib_startingschool_stschool_ckat.html
Starting School CKAT Table details Variable details

Starting School CKAT Starting School was a research project that engaged Bradford primary schools and which ran for two consecutive academic years (2012-13 and 2013-14). The project aimed to assess all children in their first (reception) year of schooling who were in schools where there were at least 10 Born in Bradford children enrolled. Ninety-four out of the 142 primary schools in Bradford were contacted in the recruitment phase. Clinical Kinematic Assessment Tool (CKAT) is a standardised, computerised assessment battery of visuo-manual motor control which comprises of tasks involving the presentation of interactive visual stimuli displayed on a touch-screen tablet laptop screen, whilst simultaneously recording participantâs responses to these stimuli via interactions with the screen using a handheld stylus. The battery of tasks presented by CKAT is described in detail in Flatters et al.Â (2014; PloS One, 9(2), e88692. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0088692), whilst the underlying software architecture and the performance metrics CKAT measures participants on are explained in Culmer, Levesley, Mon-Williams and Williams (2009; Journal of Neuroscience Methods, 184(1), 184â92. doi:10.1016/j.jneumeth.2009.07.025). To briefly summarise: (1) the CKAT Tracking task assesses participants ability to predict target movement; (2) the Aiming task assesses (discrete) feedforward and feedback control mechanisms and (3) the Tracing/Steering assesses (continuous) steering control mechanisms - all of which are considered to be fundamental sensorimotor control processes. Table details BiB_StartingSchool.stschool_ckat Cohort membership BiB Entity Participant Dimensions Updated 2024-05-14 Variable details
bib_startingschool_stschool_sdq.html

Starting School SDQ Starting School was a research project that engaged Bradford primary schools and which ran for two consecutive academic years (2012-13 and 2013-14). The project aimed to assess all children in their first (reception) year of schooling who were in schools where there were at least 10 Born in Bradford children enrolled. Ninety-four out of the 142 primary schools in Bradford were contacted in the recruitment phase. The Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) is a brief behavioural screening tool assessing psychological attributes such as emotional symptoms, conduct problems, hyperactivity, peer relationships and prosocial behaviour. This version was completed by the childâs class teacher, and also includes an impact supplement, which assesses the teacherâs perceived impact of the difficulties identified. bibbs_geographic.html
BiBBS Geographic Information Project tables
BiBBS Geographic Information Geographic and residential information Project tables
bibbs_geographic_bibbs_geog_person.html
BiBBS person level geographic information Table details Variable details

BiBBS person level geographic information Contains address information for each BiBBS participant at regular 6 month intervals from the first event of study participation (e.g.Â birth or registration). Contains person level information, such as age, property lived in, number of house moves and data quality indicators. Usage instructions: This is a long dataset, with many rows per participant, and can be used to identify which property and LSOA the participant lived in at a certain age or time point. This can be linked to property level data (including environmental exposures) using âproperty_idâ and LSOA level data using âLSOA11CDâ to obtain property/LSOA level data for specific time periods in a particpants life. Data construction: The source data for this table is address strings from monthly searches of the NHS Tracing service (e.g.Â health care records), which contain limited geographic information and are temporally irregular. To improve the quality of the geographic data, the address strings are passed through the OS Places API, which attempts to match each address string to a geo-located address, providing additional geographic information. Important information on temporal data: This dataset contains data from two separate timelines, which are important to clarify. Temporal variables fixed to the participants age such as age_m are calculated at 6 monthly periods based on date of birth. Separately, address data from NHS tracing services, such as date_address_data_received is received as and when, and may not align with the 6 monthly time periods used to structure the dataset. Where this occurs, address data for some 6 monthly time points has been interpolated from the nearest available data from NHS tracing. The variable is_data_interpolated flags if data has been interpolated, whilst months_to_closest_data_received can be used to assess the temporal difference between the participants age, and the recency of the address data. Table details BiBBS_Geographic.bibbs_geog_person Cohort membership BiBBS Entity Participant Dimensions Updated 2024-05-14 Variable details

Obtained from monthly NHS Tracing Service searches. Table details BiBBS_Geographic.bibbs_geog_property Cohort membership BiBBS Entity Property Dimensions Updated 2024-05-14 Variable details

Can be linked to bibbs_geog_person and bibbs_geog_property by âLSOA11CDâ, or can be used as a stand-alone table of unique LSOA. Obtained from monthly NHS Tracing Service searches. All IMD and Townsend variables are open data and are covered by the UK Open Government License (OGL) - please get in touch for more information. BiBBS property level air quality information Table details Variable details

BiBBS property level air quality information Building level air quality data. Contains measures of mean and maximum exposures to PM10, PM2.5 and NOx, using Bradford Council (CBMDC) and Department for Environment (DEFRA) data. Variables cover a range from exposure radii (from 100m to 2000m) measured using both circular buffers and street networks centred on the home address. Usage instructions: To link to BiBBS participants, use the property_id variable to link to bibbs_geog_person. Further information: Created by Kimon Krenz, on behalf of BiB. Please reference Krenz et al.Â (2023) when using this data, where more detailed methodological information can be found regarding the construction of these variables. bibbs_geographic_bibbs_geog_built_env_indoor_qual.html
BiBBS property level built environment and indoor building quality Table details Variable details

BiBBS property level built environment and indoor building quality Describes the immediate built environment of a participantâs address and indoor qualities of a participantâs home. Built environment (be) variables measure the geometry of the building and block containing the participants address. Indoor qualities (iq) variables uses Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) data to measure the properties energy use/efficiency and to describe the internal layout and features of the property. Usage instructions: To link to BiBBS participants, use the property_id variable to link to bibbs_geog_person. Further information: Created by Kimon Krenz, on behalf of BiB. Please reference Krenz et al.Â (2023) when using this data, where more detailed methodological information can be found regarding the construction of these variables. bibbs_geographic_bibbs_geog_food_environment.html
BiBBS property level food environment data Table details Variable details

BiBBS property level food environment data Describes the food environment surrounding a participantâs address. Includes variables for all food outlets, and only fast food outlets, with distance measured using distance decay and street networks at a range of radii (300m to 2000m). Fast food outlets are defined usind a wide definition, which includes common UK fast food chains, fish and chips shops and chicken and kebab vendors. For more details, please view pg. 24 of the suporting information accompanying Libuy et al.Â (2023) Usage instructions: To link to BiBBS participants, use the id column to link to the property_id variable in bibbs_geog_person. Further information: Created by Kimon Krenz, on behalf of Born in Bradford. bibbs_geographic_bibbs_geog_green_space.html
BiBBS property level green space data Table details Variable details

BiBBS property level green space data Contains measures relating to access to green space (parks, playgrounds, allotments, etc.) surrounding the home address. Count of, and distance to, nearest green space are measured through distance decay and street network, at a range of radii (300m to 5,000m) and green space size (â¥ 0.5ha to â¥ 100ha). Variables used in publications: gg_2021_all_count_05ha_f_2_300 has been created for use in Subiza-Perez et al.Â (2024) to measure residential greeness. See section 2.3 in referenced paper. Usage instructions: To link to BiBBS participants, use the property_id variable to link to bibbs_geog_person. Further information: Created by Kimon Krenz, on behalf of BiB. BiBBS property level public transport and traffic data Table details Variable details

BiBBS property level public transport and traffic data Summarises the availability of public transport and volume of vehicle traffic at property address. Amount of public transport access points (e.g.Â bus stops, train stations) are measured using distance decay and street network distance at a range of radii (300m to 2000m). Vehicle traffic volume is measured at morning, afternoon and evening within a street network distance of 100m and 300m, with additional measures of congestion at the same time periods. Usage instructions: To link to BiBBS participants, use the id column to link to the property_id variable in bibbs_geog_person. Further information: Created by Kimon Krenz, on behalf of Born in Bradford. Please reference Krenz et al.Â (2023) when using this data, where more detailed methodological information can be found regarding the construction of these variables. bibbs_geographic_bibbs_geog_sc_walkability_lu.html
BiBBS property level street centrality, walkability and land use data Table details Variable details

BiBBS property level street centrality, walkability and land use data Summarises the walkability and urban composition in the area surrounding the property address. Average walkability is measured through a circular buffer at a range of radii. Street centrality measures betweenness and closeness centrality of the residential street and the street network at a range of radii. Land use is measured through Shannonâs Diversity Index through a circular buffer at a range of radii. Usage instructions: To link to BiBBS participants, use the id column to link to the property_id variable in bibbs_geog_person. Further information: Created by Kimon Krenz, on behalf of Born in Bradford. Please reference Krenz et al.Â (2023) when using this data, where more detailed methodological information can be found regarding the construction of these variables. bibbs_geographic_bibbs_geog_ndvi_longitudinal.html
BiBBS property level longitudinal NDVI data Table details Variable details

BiBBS property level longitudinal NDVI data Longitudinal NDVI data for all years from 2016 to 2022. Calculated the mean for standard circular buffer around home addresses for radii of 100, 300, 500, 1000, 1500, and 2000m using USGS Landsat 8 data. For 2020 there is also NDVI calculated using street network based catchment areas of 100, 300, 500 and 1000m. ** Notes on missing data** There is no cloud-free satellite imagery for the years 2021 and 2017 that covers the entire area of Bradford, meaning there are missing values for both years for properties in south east Bradford. Missing data could be inferred by calculating the average value of the years before and after the years with no data. Usage instructions: To link to BiBBS participants, use the property_id variable to link to bibbs_geog_person. Further information: Created by Kimon Krenz, on behalf of BiB. Please reference Krenz et al.Â (2023) when using this data, where more detailed methodological information can be found regarding the construction of these variables. BiB4All property level longitudinal NDVI data Table details Variable details

BiB4All property level longitudinal NDVI data Longitudinal NDVI data for all years from 2016 to 2022. Calculated the mean for standard circular buffer around home addresses for radii of 100, 300, 500, 1000, 1500, and 2000m using USGS Landsat 8 data. For 2020 there is also NDVI calculated using street network based catchment areas of 100, 300, 500 and 1000m. ** Notes on missing data** There is no cloud-free satellite imagery for the years 2021 and 2017 that covers the entire area of Bradford, meaning there are missing values for both years for properties in south east Bradford. Missing data could be inferred by calculating the average value of the years before and after the years with no data.
